nodes.bodyText:
very good use case for a mixin!
https://github.com/drublic/Sass-Mixins/blob/master/partials/_appearance.scss
What's the advantage to a mixin? Does it mean you can modify elements by intrumenting their existing classes? Ie: you don't need to go into the markup of the tool, you can just mod the compiled sass?

it only makes sense if this pattern is being repeated .....  so instead of using all these -appearance attributes, it would be one call
if it's not a repeated pattern, ignore

It's not at the moment. I moved it up out of rubrics as I was trying to use the number type in grader. That didn't work out, tbh, so I could just move it back down into the rubrics scss. It's not repeated, though, just a class you can layer on.
I'm with @ottenhoff, I think this should be change to a mixin for using in the future
For what reason, though? All you need to do is just add the class, bootstrap style, to your element, and you have the styles. I'm not bothered either way, but I'm curious.

That just seems like pre optimisation to me. Why bother if we don't have a use for it yet? But, if that pattern exists in other places then we should open another JIRA to clean up those places and consolidate in a mixin.
